page.title: 06EDUCATION TYPICAL SCHOOL DAY
page.content: I arrive at school at twenty-five to nine.The bell rings at ten past nine. The children go to their classrooms. First Mr.Jones our teacher marks the register.We then have a school assembly.We sing hymns,read a story and pray.We then all go back into our classrooms.Then we start our sums out of our text books or from the blackboard.Having finished our sums the bell rings for playtime at half past ten.When we come in we do our English or Welsh.At twelve o'clock we have lunch.School starts at one o'clock.We have radio and television programmes ,music,pottery,painting, woodwork and sewing.We have a ten minute break in the afternoon.We usually finish the day with a game outside or in the hall depending on the weather.
